event_name: Italy Pavilion, also hosting the Holy See　～15:00
event_summary: The Italy Pavilion is a modern reinterpretation of the Ideal City of the Renaissance by architect Mario Cucinella.Its theme is “Art regenerates Life”. Art is intended in its broader sense, from craftsmanship to fashion and design, from engineering to research and innovation.Live events and exhibitions will showcase the best of Made in Italy, where high technology merges with tradition.Visitors are greeted at the entrance by a theatre, an homage to Italian creativity.reservation for until 15:00.

event_name: Australia Pavilion - Chasing the Sun
event_summary: [Duration: 15 minutes] [You may arrive up to 15 mins before your reservation time] Embark on a one-of-a-kind multisensory adventure as you follow the sun across Australia. Immerse yourself in the sounds, sights and smells of Australia and be surprised as you wander through the tranquil bush, gaze into the night sky, and dive into waterways. Discover the deep connection between Australia's First Nations peoples and Country and learn how ancient wisdom is guiding a more sustainable future. Experience a world where the past, present and future come together to create a brighter tomorrow. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old.

event_name: Netherlands Pavilion Common Ground
event_summary: Common Ground is the theme of the Netherlands participation. Netherlands Pavilion aims to be an open space where people can meet, learn from each other, and inspire one another. A place where we can unite our energy to create healthy and happy societies.As a message of hope for a resilient future, the design of the Netherlands Pavilion features an anthropogenic (‘man-made’) sun. It symbolises the rising sun – a future empowered by collaboration and energy that is clean, unlimited, and accessible for all: a new dawn.

Centered on the concept of Regeneration, the pavilion will showcase Canada’s diversity, creativity, and commitment to sustainability.

event_name: UN Pavilion
event_summary: [Duration: 20 minutes] Experience the UN Pavilion at Expo 2025, where over 30 UN agencies unite under the theme “United for a Better Future.” Discover a stunning immersive movie in the massive half-dome theater, walk through 80 years of UN history on the “Timeline Wall,” and explore the 'Orb Room,' where everyday objects reveal connections to the UN's impact worldwide. Enjoy interactive exhibits, workshops, a photo booth, and a gift shop with exclusive UN-themed products. Join us in tackling global challenges and advancing the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) for a brighter future.

event_summary: The Hungarian Pavilion emphasizes a close connection to nature and the preservation of culture. Its central theme is folk music, which not only features prominently in the exhibition space but also in the main attraction, an immersive performance in the central area. Duration: 30 min.  *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old.

event_name: NTT Pavilion※Arrive 15 minutes before the reservation time
event_summary: The NTT Pavilion offers visitors an astonishing experience with a look at the future of communications using IOWN, a next-generation communications infrastructure, to transcend physical distances and emotional barriers and share not only video and audio, but also actual spaces that are at a distance and the sensory experiences of people and objects in a different place. Duration of experience: 30 minutes. Note: The reception opens 15 minutes prior to reservation times. Please be aware of the following points when making a reservation. Intense light, large sounds, darkness, the use of 3D glasses, and other experiences are involved. Visitors may be photographed or recorded and used as part of the presentation. Children under the age of three are also permitted to enter. The experience is wheelchair accessible. Assistance dogs may accompany visitors. For other cautionary information, please refer to the overview on the event website before making your reservation.

event_name: Signature Pavilion MIYATA Hiroaki”Better Co-Being”
event_summary: 【Duration:45 min】【Reception Time:5mins. before your reservation】It is a pavilion like no other, with no roof or walls, seamlessly blending into the forest of tranquility at the center of the Expo site.Here, we consider “Resonance” to be the essence of technology that leads to a transformation of civilization, and share questions about the connection to other people, the world, and the future in a space that dissolves boundaries. Visitors will have the opportunity to think about the future through experiences based on art, walking together in harmony between the diverse well-being of each individual and a sustainable future. We hope that the resonant experiences with visitors will provide clues to “Future Society for Our Lives”. *If you are late for the reception time, you won't be able to enter. *You will need a smartphone and the web application to access the experience. For other notes, please check our pavilion website before visiting.

event_summary: [Duration: 37 minutes][Reception: within reservation time] Experience explosive creativity at the Jellyfish Pavilion, a place of once-in-a-lifetime encounters. At the top (G) floor, enjoy sensory music around the 'Tree of Creation' and participate in intermittent workshops. In the underground (B) Floor, feel the 'Roots of Life' (reservation required) and sharpen your senses in darkness and explore life with 360° videos. Embrace a unique, immersive experience as you dance with the sounds of the world.

event_summary:

event_name: Signature Pavilion OCHIAI Yoichi 'null²' Naorai Mode *10 min before the reservation start time
event_summary: ［AverageDuration:10min］［10 min before the reservation start time］Naorai Mode – Farewell to the Forest of NullThis 10-minute ceremony is the final Naorai shared by the pavilion and its visitors. Soon, null² will return to Nul, and we celebrate its departure through a feast. In a space that shifts from the solemn resonance of a Buddhist indō (ritual of farewell) to the lively rhythms of festival applause and cheers, all participants become one community, sharing “goodbye” and “thank you.” It is not an end, but a prayer and a hospitable rite for a new beginning.
virtual_url_desc: Click here for Virtual Expo

event_name: DYNAMIC EQUILIBRIUM OF LIFE　Produced by FUKUOKA Shin-Ichi
event_summary: 【MeetingTime:As indicated】【Time:15min.after entering】Experience a three-dimensional, interactive installation imbued with light that spreads across the pavilion space, where your body transforms into particles of light, allowing you to traverse the 3.8-billion-year history of life in a dynamic tapestry. Life maintains balance by continuously breaking itself down and rebuilding, coexisting through altruistic behaviors that support each other. Through this, you will learn about the flow of 'dynamic equilibrium,' which is the essence of life.
virtual_url_desc: Click here for the Virtual Expo

event_name: DYNAMIC EQUILIBRIUM OF LIFE　Produced by FUKUOKA Shin-Ichi　Haptics
event_summary: 【MeetingTime: As indicated】【Time:15min.after entering】Experience a dynamic tapestry of life, tracing 3.8 billion years of life's history with a three-dimensional theater system composed of 320,000 delicate light particles, where your own body becomes one with the particles of light. In the Tactile Experience Accessibility Zone, those requiring visual or auditory assistance can feel vibrations from the floor and tactile devices synchronized with sound and video for enhanced immersion. We also offer audio guides using open-ear headphones and tablets featuring subtitle displays.

event_name: Signature Pavilion　KOYAMA Kundo　”EARTH MART”
event_summary: 【Duration: 30 - 40 minutes】【Reception time: during the reserved time】【Theme: Cycle of Lives】【Producer: KOYAMA Kundo】This is an imaginary supermarket. It is full of exciting shopping-like experiences that will reset your assumptions and make you rethink about the cuisine of the future. In the “Marketplace of Life”, you will encounter the stories of the effervescent diversity of life that sustains our diet. In the “Marketplace of the Future”, you will glimpse a vision of the future and its technology - the wisdom and ingenuity of cuisine to be spun together for our future world. We will pickle “Expo-Pickles (Umeboshi)” in the pavilion during the exposition, and you have a chance to get coupons to eat them in 2050.

event_name: Signature Pavilion KAWASE Naomi 'Dialogue Theater - sign of life -'
event_summary: [Duration:55min.]This pavilion serves as an experimental ground, Unveiling 'divides' scattered throughout the world and through 'dialogue,' we seek to resolve.Dialogue, it awakens us, To the possibility of deeper understanding, That within me, you reside, And within you, I abide.Together, we can forge, A brighter future, side by side.Now, let us together step forth, Within this pavilion, Towards a future free from division. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old.

event_name: Signature Pavilion KAWASE Naomi 'Dialogue Theater - sign of life -'　Documentary Footage
event_summary: [Duration:45min.]To create Dialogue Theater - sign of life, the production team visited Totsukawa Village in Nara Prefecture and Fukuchiyama City in Kyoto Prefecture on many occasions. There, they took over the old school buildings and interacted with the local community. KAWASE Naomi directed films that were produced to record the history of the school buildings before relocation, as well as the memories of the former students who spent their days there amid rich natural surroundings. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old.

event_name: Signature Pavilion KAWASE Naomi 'Dialogue Theater - sign of life -' Documentary Wheelchair use

To create Dialogue Theater, the production team visited Totsukawa Village in Nara Pref. and Fukuchiyama City in Kyoto Pref. on many occasions. There, they took over the old school buildings and interacted with the local community. KAWASE Naomi directed films that were produced to record the history of the school buildings before relocation, as well as the memories of the former students who spent their days there amid rich natural surroundings. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old.

event_name: Advanced Air Mobility Station
event_summary: [Duration 45min]This is an exhibition facility of a future society with eVTOLs, offering a comprehensive experience using vibrations, sound, and visuals.If you fall into following categories, please inform to our staff. -Individuals having difficulty in standing or walking on their own, having medical devices such as pacemakers which may be affected by vibrations or magnets, with prosthetic limbs, white cane users, pregnant women, and wheelchair users. -Children aged 6 and under can experience the exhibit while holding hands with their guardians.

This music entertainment show brings together diverse performers who combine their talents with cutting-edge technology.Opening Time:One hour before showtimeSeating:Reserved block seating (free seating within the block)Notes:Wheelchair users are to reserve wheelchair seats (may be accompanied by one chaperone). Persons with assistance dogs or requiring staff support should book priority seating. For additional details, refer to the Expo app.

event_name: Panasonic Pavilion day“Unlock Festival”【TBD】AA
event_summary: [OPEN 13:00/ START 14:00/ FINISH 16:00] / [If you wish to participate in a wheelchair, you will need to make a reservation in the wheelchair block. ]/[If you require a seat under 3 years old, reservations are required]/ The concept of the Panasonic Group Pavilion “The Land of NOMO' is 'Unleash your mind, your body, yourself and the world.“  We want to provide an opportunity to feel the power to believe in yourself and find the courage to take a step forward through dance, choir, and co-creation activities. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name: DRUM TAO 「THE　WADAIKO」　　AA
event_summary: 【Date：May 14 - May 15】【Doors open are 1 hour before the show starts】*Customers using wheelchair are requested to make a reservation in the wheelchair seats.*Please refrain from entering with strollers.【Performer】 DRUM TAO　【Summary】Expressing tradition and innovation through cutting-edge/pioneering stage arts, this performance crafts a compelling story in collaboration with visuals. World-renowned fashion designer Junko Koshino's costumes will elevate the experience into the ultimate fusion of art and beat! ■Non-verbal taiko-drumming entertainments Show(45min)/Please enjoy it. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name: EXPO2025 'One Step to the Future! -Voices of Love Connects the World-' Arena
event_summary: SUMMARY:The Kansai born Takarazuka Revue is expanding its activities both domestically and internationally. The Takarazuka graduates will present a unique entertainment by reciting famous Takarazuka scenes and songs that have a connection with each country. DATES: 29 Apr - 1 May. DOORS OPEN: 1 hr before show. RUN TIME: Approx. 80 mins. SEATS: Reserved in blocks (free seating within blocks.) NOTES: Wheelchair users, please reserve wheelchair seats (can be accompanied by one carer.) Pre-school children are not permitted. For other details, please check the official website and the Visitors app. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name: EXPO KYOTO MEETING
event_summary: [Please arrive by the start time] / [If participating in a wheelchair, reservations are required for the wheelchair block. ]/[If you require a seat under 3 years old, reservations are required]/  [Summary] EXPO KYOTO MEETING will feature talk sessions focusing on the Expo's overall theme of “The Heart of Japan and the Future of the Earth” and Kyoto's special features of “Environment,” “Arts,” “Healthcare” and “Future'. In addition, Kyoto's traditional culture and performances by young people will be presented at the opening and other events to show the world what Kyoto has to offer.

In addition, Kyoto's traditional culture and performances by young people will be presented at the opening and other events to show the world what Kyoto has to offer.

event_name: Tetsuko's room　Public recording in EXPO 2025
event_summary: The talk show 'Tetsuko’s room,' which began in 1976 and is entering its 50th year this year, will hold a public recording at EXPO2025. One guest is Bunshi Katsura, making his 10th appearance on the show. As he resides in Osaka, raising curiosity about how it will unfold. The other guests are the three Kosino sisters,Hiroko, Junko, and Michiko Kosino, internationally active fashion designers. Raised in Kishiwada, by their mother who ran a Western-style clothing store,' the sisters will share secret stories from their hometown.

event_name: NTT Day CHO-KABUKI Powered by IOWN『HANAKURABESENBONZAKURA Expo2025 ver.』　ＡＡ
event_summary: Overview: Shido Nakamura and Miku Hatsune will co-perform on 'CHO-KABUKI Powered by IOWN 'Hanakurabe Senbonzakura Expo2025 ver.'' at the Expo Hall during NTT Pavilion Day. Enjoy innovative stage direction using next-generation infrastructure 'IOWN,' blending tradition and future entertainment. Date: 5/24, 5/25 Duration: 2 hours Seat: Block Designation (reserved tickets at entrance). Some seats may have restricted views. Note: Opens 1 hours before the show. Accessible seats available with reservation; 1 caregiver can accompany without a separate reservation. Check the Visitors app for details.

event_name: NARAtive ＠EXPO Hall
event_summary: “NARAtive” is a film production project involving the local community of Nara Prefecture, which producer KAWASE Naomi has been developing since before the Expo.With film as its core, NARAtive continues to create new dialogue and communication, connecting Nara with the present and the future, Nara with the world.This dialogue event with producer Kawase Naomi, people involved in the production of films created through “NARAtive,” and the people of Nara who support the films will be held as a joint project between Nara and the local governments that have supported the film production.

event_name: Noh for SDGs Upper Level　A Block
event_summary: An original production of “Nohgaku,” a Japanese traditional theatre designated as UNESCO’s Intangible Cultural Heritage. Setting “purification of water,” as its theme, it features a story that waterfowls restore polluted river. It is a participatory theatre that about 160 children of Japan and abroad perform waterfowls and performers and audience members chant lyric of noh poem together. Collaboration of multinational band  is also a highlight. 【DATE】June 18 ①11:00　②14:30【Doors open】①10:30②14:00【Seating】Free seating in the designated area

event_name: Jikei COM social contribution musical 「Gateway to tomorrow」  Reserved seats
event_summary: This musical was first performed in February 1994. Students who learned about the reality of bone marrow transplantation and the bone marrow bank project realized, 'What can we do?' and planned, produced, and performed in this musical that has been passed down for 30 years as a social contribution effort. Through this musical, our students hope to convey to as many people as possible that there are lives that can be saved through bone marrow transplants.[Date: June 16th] [Doors open] 30 minutes before the start of the show [Notes] Wheelchair accessible seats must be reserved.

event_name: “Bourbon Presents ‘Mezamashi Classics Concert’ Produced by Fuji TV” Level AA Block
event_summary: This special Expo concert will feature a brilliant performance by violinist TAKASHIMA Chisako and a light-hearted talk by Fuji Television announcer KARUBE Shinichi. The concert will align with the theme of the Expo 2025 Osaka, Kansai, Japan, “Designing Future Society for Our Lives”, while also promoting the concept of “making classical music more accessible and easy to enjoy”, which inspired the creation of this concert project. [Date: Sunday, June 29] [Time: 3:00PM-4:30PM] [Doors Open: 2:00PM] [Seating: Block-designated seating (free seating within each block) *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name: GUNDAM NEXT FUTURE PAVILION -パビリオンデー ガンダムオーケストラ- ブロックAA
event_summary: 『機動戦士ガンダム』シリーズが45年以上に渡り、多様な作品で描いてきた「宇宙時代」を映像と音楽で辿ります。大阪交響楽団の豊かな音楽表現と、西川貴教さん他ゲストによる多彩なパフォーマンスでお客様を「新たな宇宙世紀」へといざないます。ガンダムの主題歌を中心に繰り広げられる、ここでしか味わえない音楽体験をお楽しみください。【出演者】指揮：中田延亮　演奏：大阪交響楽団　出演：西川貴教/T.M.Revolutionほか【開場17:00/開演18:00/終演19:45（予定)】/【車いすでの参加の際は車いす用のブロックで予約必要】/【3歳以下席予約必要】　※３歳以下のお子様も座席を使いたい場合は予約必要です。

event_name: Planet Earth III Live in Concert with Japan Century Symphony Orchestra - Block A
event_summary: Following a series of sell-out concerts across Europe, the BBC Studios award-winning series Planet Earth III will be shown on the big screen and accompanied by a live musical performance from the Japan Century Symphony Orchestra. Join us for the Asia premiere of Planet Earth III Live in Concert and celebrate the wonders of our natural world in the first-of-its-kind screening in Japan. Please arrive at least 30 minutes before the start time. The performance will start at 15:30 and end 16:30. Wheelchair users will need to make a reservation in the wheelchair block.

event_name: Japanese　Cuisine　Wonder　Trip
event_summary:
【Estimated time required: 60 minutes】
"WASHOKU” has been registered as a UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage as a traditional Japanese food culture, and ‘Japanese Cuisine’ continues to evolve while incorporating foreign food culture into it. Why don't you participate in a quiz using your smartphone and explore the appeal of Japanese food with our specialists?
We will offer wonderful prizes to those who score high in the quiz, so please join us!

※Please prepare your smartphone or tablet.
※Please bear the communication fee.

event_name: Oto Doraku EXPO – Indulge in Music – Sponsored by Daiwa House　Upper Level
event_summary: Popular artists will gather at EXPO Hall “Shining Hat” for a special LIVE performance. It will showcase Japanese music that we want to leave behind and share with the world. The event will feature vocal performances that collaborate with Japanese culture, alongside talk shows with artists, delivering a full experience of Japanese entertainment via live broadcast! *Information about the performers and event details will be announced later. [Opening Time] Scheduled for 1:00 PM (subject to change). [Note] For further details and important notices, please check the Visitors app and the URL link.

event_name: 山海天光 スタンド席　Aブロック
event_summary: 【車いすでの参加の際は車いす用のブロックで予約必要。】/【３歳以下のお子様も座席を使いたい場合は予約必要です】/【概要】台湾の大型国際パフォーマンスチームが登場。歌、踊り、音楽、ライブパフォーマンスとスマート技術を融合し、主題である『山海』『天』『光』を通じて壮大な物語が展開されます。本公演を通じて、『世界をつなぎ、より良い未来の暮らしへ』というコンセプトを来場者に体感いただき、インタラクティブで感動的な体験を提供することを目指しています。　※３歳以下のお子様も座席を使いたい場合は予約必要です。

event_name: Harmony of Okinawa Karate and Okinawa Traditional Performing Arts/AA
event_summary: [Please arrive at least 30 minutes before the start] / [If you wish to participate in a wheelchair, you will need to make a reservation in the wheelchair block. ]/[If you require a seat under 3 years old, reservations are required]/ [Performance〕Okinawa Karate, Ryukyu Traditional Performing Arts, Eisa[Summary] Okinawa karate is said to be a ''war of peace'' because of its ''kata,'' which begins with uke, and its teachings of respecting the lives of others and not attacking others. It will be performed on stage along with Ryukyu dance and Eisa.

event_name: Okayama Children's Musical “Harold!”　Upper Level　block　A
event_summary: 【Overview】 A local cultural creation project in which performers are recruited from elementary to high school in Okayama, who join forces with pro theater staff to achieve a musical performance.It’s an original musical “MADE IN OKAYAMA” depicts the rich nature and life in Okayama, children's friendship.【Show Timings】August 12, 13 【Opening】1 hour before the performance【Seating】 Reserved block seats (unreserved seats within a block) 【Note】 Guests using wheelchairs, please reserve wheelchair seats. (One accompanying caregiver is allowed.)/Preschooler are not allowed to enter.

event_name: MUTEK.JP １０周年スペシャルプログラム ブロックC
event_summary: イベント情報:MUTEK.JP10周年記念プログラム！電子音楽とデジタルアートの祭典が贈る特別な一夜。プレゼンテーション、インスタレーション、ライブパフォーマンス、ドローンショーなど多彩なコンテンツを展開。出演は古い電化製品を楽器に変える異才、エレクトロニコス・ファンタスティコス！唯一無二のオーケストラパフォーマンスは必見。海外の方も楽しめるプログラムです。開催日時： 6月27日（金）会場： EXPO ホール 「 シャインハット 」【開場時間17:30/開演時間18:00/終演時間20:00】注意点：開場は17:30-18:00 まで。途中退出、参加有。3歳以下は予約不要。

event_name: アート体感「LIFEいのち with スーパーキッズ・オーケストラ」 【A・B・Cブロック】 前方左スタンド席
event_summary: 超時空のいのちの旅。いのちは、宇宙から旅をしてきた─その記憶を、あなたの“心と身体”で再び受け取る時がきました。壮大なスケールで体感するART映像『LIFEいのち』と世界的指揮者・佐渡裕氏が最も愛情を注ぐスーパーキッズ・オーケストが生演奏の音楽と映像で呼び覚ます。世界中の親子を感動で包んだ体験が今、あなたの目の前に広がります。【開催日9月27日】【開場1時間前】【ブロック内自由席】【英語翻訳あり】【車いす席の方は車いす席をご予約ください】【予約は開場時間まで】【開場時間後の空きの有無、予約不要席は直接EXPOホールにお越しください】座席位置は「LIFEいのち」公式サイトにてご確認ください　※３歳以下のお子様も座席を使いたい場合は予約必要です。

event_name: Planet Earth III Live in Concert with Japan Century Symphony Orchestra - Block A
event_summary:
Following a series of sell-out concerts across Europe, the BBC Studios award-winning series Planet Earth III will be shown on the big screen and accompanied by a live musical performance from the Japan Century Symphony Orchestra. Join us for the Planet Earth III Live in Concert and celebrate the wonders of our natural world in the first-of-its-kind screening in Japan. 
Please arrive at least 30 minutes before the start time. The performance will start at 15:30 and end 16:35. Wheelchair users will need to make a reservation in the wheelchair block.

event_name: プラネットアースIII ライブ・イン・コンサートwith 日本センチュリー交響楽団   ブロックE
event_summary:
ヨーロッパ各地でチケットが完売した、受賞歴を誇るBBC Studiosの自然史ドキュメンタリーシリーズ「プラネットアースIII 」とオーケストラの生演奏が融合したライブ公演を、日本センチュリー交響楽団の演奏でお届けします。「プラネットアースIIIライブ・イン・コンサート」の日本初となる特別公演で、壮大な自然界の驚異を共に体感しましょう。

開演時間の30分前までにご来場ください。開演15:30、終演16:35となります。車椅子をご利用の方は、車椅子席のご予約が必要です。

event_name: Osaka wellness action 10 EXPOLIVE!
event_summary: [Summary] An event where you can experience 'Kenkatsu 10'- Osaka Wellness action through a live music show by Enka singer 'Midori Oka', a dance show by world-famous dancer ' Kento Mori', a talk show about  Osaka EXPO healthy menus , and more. [Performers] Midori Oka, Kento Mori, Hirohito Hayashi, Yoshio Itoi, and more [Date] July 25th [Doors open] 30 minutes before the start of the show [Seats] Reserved seats (seats will be provided by staff on the day) [Notes] For details on participation, please check the 'Kenkatsu 10'-Osaka Wellness action portal site. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name: The world of Nohgaku connects us to the future - Arena Compassionate Seats
event_summary: A space to experience Noh from a new perspective. General Director, Mansai Nomura.The Noh stage will be themed around 'ONI（demon/ogre）' and will also evoke the image of 'the four seasons of Japan.'Enjoy a new and immersive Noh experience with this dynamic, complex production that combines live performance and video. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name: EXPO RESONANCE FESTIAL STAND
event_summary: Front seats in the stands at the EXPO Resonance Fest concert. 〜Better Co-Being x Yomiuri Nippon Symphony Orchestra String Quartet Concert will allow the audience to experience the "Better Co-Being" philosophy of producer Hiroaki Miyata through music. The Yomiuri Nippon Symphony Orchestra, one of Japan's leading orchestras, has assembled a lineup of top-class players to create a challenging program that is unique to this occasion and will resonate with the audience. (Please note that some of the audience may be guided to the front block at the rear of the stands.

event_name: The Orchestra of null² – supported by Rohm Music Foundation/Arena Seats
event_summary: 【Reception 14:30 / Start 15:00 /  Ends around 17:00】【Wheelchair seats must be reserved. No preschool children allowed】Directed by Yoichi OCHIAI, conducted by Junichi HIROKAMI (Friend of JPO). Featuring Masaki UMANO (Noh), Manzo NOMURA and others (Kyogen), and the Japan Philharmonic Orchestra.　Program includes works by Ikuma DAN, Toru TAKEMITSU, Hikaru HAYASHI, Yugo KANNO, Ryuichi SAKAMOTO, Dai FUJIKURA (new commission “Water Mirror”), and Ottorino RESPIGHI.　With live performance and visual effects. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name: OSAKATOIN HighSchool SymphonicBand SpecialConcert in EXPO General Admission
event_summary: [Overview]The Osaka Toin High School Wind Ensemble, famous for TV and Koshien performances, will appear at the Osaka-Kansai Expo! Enjoy the heartfelt harmonies of 167 members who give over 120 concerts a year. With musical-style performances and a request corner, it’s a show full of variety and emotion. Don’t miss this special experience![Date] Sunday, June 29[Doors Open] 30 minutes before the show[Seating] Free seating[Notes]Wheelchair users, please reserve wheelchair seats (1 caregiver allowed).See the Visitors app for details and guidelines.

event_name: General Use / KIBO SPACE LIVE in EXPO2025
event_summary: Experience the world’s first live connection between the International Space Station (ISS) and Expo Hall via the “KIBO Space Broadcasting Station”—the only two-way studio linking space and Earth, installed on the ISS. Enjoy real-time space sunrises and satellite data visualizations that inspire curiosity and reflection on Earth’s future.  / 3 unique sessions—see website for details. / [1st] 11:00–12:00 / [2nd] 13:00–14:00 / [3rd] 18:00–20:00 (Doors open 30 min prior) / Admission by reservation order / Ages 3+ require reservation (not needed if seated on guardian’s lap)

event_name: Wheelchair Users Only / KIBO SPACE LIVE in EXPO2025
event_summary: Experience the world’s first live connection between the International Space Station (ISS) and Expo Hall via the “KIBO Space Broadcasting Station”—the only two-way studio linking space and Earth, installed on the ISS. Enjoy real-time space sunrises and satellite data visualizations that inspire curiosity and reflection on Earth’s future. / Wheelchair seating reservation only (1 companion allowed). / 3 unique sessions—see website for details. / [1st] 11:00–12:00 / [2nd] 13:00–14:00 / [3rd] 18:00–20:00 (Doors open 30 min prior) / Admission by reservation order.

event_name: XROBOCON-Summon! XTREME Sumo-　 Rear left Seats
event_summary: Traditional sumo, a cornerstone of cultural heritage of Japan, evolves with cutting-edge technology, delivering a dynamic battle between robots and avatars that captivates the audience.Furthermore, a real-time cheering system allows spectators' voices to directly impact the match,immersing the entire venue in an electrifying wave of excitement.Witness firsthand the boundless potential of young creators and engineers as they boldly take on new challenges! *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name: Japan Day Official Ceremony and Event Left Seating Area
event_summary:
［Dates] Thursday, July 3, 2025 13:30-15:00 
[Reception Time] 12:30-13:00 
[Summary] At international expositions, one day during the event is designated as “National Day” for each official participant in order to honor their participation and promote international understanding and goodwill. The Osaka-Kansai Expo has designated Thursday, July 3 as Japan Day, and this is the reservation page for the official ceremonies and events scheduled to be held by the government at the Expo site as part of the Japan Day.

event_summary: The 'High School Students' Dream Award in Osaka/Kansai Expo'is a contest in which high school students, who will be responsible for the future,combine solving social problems with their own dreams and formulatingbusiness ideas to make them come true. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name: Noh for SDGs Upper Level　A Block
event_summary: An original production of “Nohgaku,” a Japanese traditional theatre designated as UNESCO’s Intangible Cultural Heritage. Setting “purification of water,” as its theme, it features a story that waterfowls restore polluted river. It is a participatory theatre that about 160 children of Japan and abroad perform waterfowls and performers and audience members chant lyric of noh poem together. Collaboration of multinational band  is also a highlight. 【DATE】June 18 ①13:00　②16:30【Doors open】①12:00②15:30【Seating】Free seating in the designated area

event_name: WAKAYAMA DAY “The journey of the soul begins here.”
event_summary:
Doors Open 9:45/Performance Starts 10:30/Ends 12:00
If you will be attending in a wheelchair, please reserve a seat in the wheelchair section (one companion may sit with you).
When using a seat, even children aged 3 and under must have their own reservation.

Wakayama is home to Kumano, a sacred place of nature worship, and Koyasan, a Buddhist sanctuary with 1,200 years of history—both UNESCO World Heritage Sites.
At “Wakayama Day”, experience the region’s deep spirituality, rich culture, and timeless traditions through captivating stage performances.

event_name: WAKAYAMA DAY “The journey of the soul begins here.” Wheelchair seat
event_summary:
Doors Open 9:45/Performance Starts 10:30/Ends 12:00
If you will be attending in a wheelchair, please reserve a seat in the wheelchair section (one companion may sit with you).
When using a seat, even children aged 3 and under must have their own reservation.

Wakayama is home to Kumano, a sacred place of nature worship, and Koyasan, a Buddhist sanctuary with 1,200 years of history—both UNESCO World Heritage Sites.
At “Wakayama Day”, experience the region’s deep spirituality, rich culture, and timeless traditions through captivating stage performances.

event_name: ČÁSLAVSKÁ – TOKYO – 1964　General seats
event_summary:
General seats
This stage production is inspired by the success of Věra Čáslavská, a prominent female gymnast at the 1964 Tokyo Olympics. Based on true events but presented as fiction, the play explores the encounter and cultural exchange between Japan and the Czech Republic. Japanese and Czech puppeteers perform together, weaving the story through various forms such as puppetry, shadow play, and video projection. Japanese and Czech sports commentators guide the audience throughout. Please note that entry and exit during the performance are not permitted.

event_name: ČÁSLAVSKÁ – TOKYO – 1964　Wheelchair Accessible Seats
event_summary:
Wheelchair Accessible Seats
This stage production is inspired by the success of Věra Čáslavská, a prominent female gymnast at the 1964 Tokyo Olympics. Based on true events but presented as fiction, the play explores the encounter and cultural exchange between Japan and the Czech Republic. Japanese and Czech puppeteers perform together, weaving the story through various forms such as puppetry, shadow play, and video projection. Japanese and Czech sports commentators guide the audience throughout. Please note that entry and exit during the performance are not permitted.

event_name: null²-an Tea Ceremony from the New World/Arena Seats
event_summary: [Reception14:30/Start15:00/End~18:00][Wheelchair users require seat reservation / No preschool children allowed][Performers (a–z, titles omitted): Yachiyo INOUE, Shohei IWASAKI (cond.), Urasenke Konnichian, Yoichi OCHIAI, Ihee HOSOTSUJI, Pilsen Philharmonic Orchestra]A sensory tea ceremony where Yoichi OCHIAI’s "Digital Nature" meets Chado. Featuring traditional temae, From the New World, generative CG, layered sound, lighting, utensils. With MirroredBody, the Grand Master’s movements and tea talk blend tradition and tech—offering a fluid, null² experience of East and West, body and data.

event_name: Japan Ground Self-Defense Force Middle Army Band　General seats
event_summary:
General seats
Japanese anime has now become a part of Japanese culture that is loved by people of all ages around the world.
In this concert, we are proud to present a powerful live performance of many well-known anime songs by the Middle Army Band of the JGSDF.
The program features a wide variety of songs spanning different genres and eras, including theme songs that captivated us in our childhood and music that enhances popular anime.
To everyone who discovered Japanese culture through anime, and to all music lovers, we hope to share with you the full charm of wind ensemble music.

event_name: EARTH MART DAY (SPECIAL PROGRAMS)
event_summary: EARTH MART DAY is a signature event produced by KOYAMA Kundo, the creator of the signature pavilion EARTH MART. With the theme of 'A day to brighten the future of food,' the first part will feature a program inviting various guests to think about the future of food and agriculture, while the second part will be the final competition to determine the top chef of the next generation. There will also be a Good Food Park in the outdoor plaza where you can experience the various possibilities of food. Many guests will be appearing, so food lovers are welcome to join us! *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name: UAE DAY AT EXPO 2025 OSAKA　General seats
event_summary:
General seats 
The UAE Day at Expo serves as the symbolic pinnacle of our journey - a moment when surface layers of technological achievement are stripped away to reveal the deeper foundation of our progress: community bonds, storytelling traditions, and ancestral knowledge that have guided us through rapid change. Rooted in shared values with Japan and inspired by Expo’s theme of Designing Future for Our Lives, the day is a celebration of UAE’s unique ability to bridge cultures, ideas, and innovation towards solutions that empower lives, from Earth to Ether.

event_name: PEACE DAY2025@EXPO
event_summary:
[Showtime: 11:45–19:00]
Let’s create just one day when people do not fight.

On September 21st, the International Day of Peace (Peace Day), we will host a special program at the Osaka/Kansai Expo.
Through special live performances by artists who support this mission, as well as talk sessions themed around peace, we will explore actions we can take—together—to realize a more peaceful world.

event_name: SF Kyogen “Mono no Aware” –　Japanese Traditional Theatre “Kyogen” Reimagined in Sci-Fi 1st Floor Sea
event_summary:
[Admission: until 30 minutes before start] / [Wheelchair users must reserve in designated wheelchair blocks] / [children under 6 will not be admitted.]
[Cast /Artists] Miyake Tōkurō tenth, Yuima Nakazato, Etsuko Yakushimaru and others
[Overview]
A new Kyogen (Japanese traditional theatre) play inspired by Mono no Aware, a short SF story by American author Ken Liu, winner of the Hugo, Nebula, and World Fantasy Awards. Crossing the frontiers of art, science, performance, and technology, this work reexamines the meaning of Japanese tradition and pursues innovation in expression.

event_name: BIE DAY Official Ceremony  Left Seating Area
event_summary:
【Event Schedule】Date: Sunday, 12 October, 2025 Time: 11AM – 12PM
【Reception】10AM – 11AM
【Overview】The BIE Day is an occasion for the Bureau International des Expositions (BIE) and its Member States to celebrate the World Expo as it draws to a close and to commemorate the achievements made. The official ceremony will feature speeches by the BIE and Japanese officials as well as cultural performances from the organisers of Expo 2025 Osaka Kansai and upcoming Expos.
* No reservation is required for children under the age of 3. One child per guardian may sit on their lap during the event.

event_name: Taikodai bearer experience
event_summary: The “Niihama Taiko Festival'' is held every October, and a total of 54”Taikodai'' , gorgeous and magnificent, travel around the city. Taikodai is a type of float that is approximately 5.5m high, 12m long, and weighs approximately 3 tons, and is held up by about 150 bearers called “Kakifu”. The highlight is the competition called “Kakikurabe''.　At this event, Taikodai that operate at the Niihama Taiko Festival will take part and perform impressive performances.　You can also experience being a bearer, and through Japanese festivals,  share the excitement with people all over the world.

event_name: 昭和平成令和 みんなが踊りたい大ヒット曲！国民投票ベスト３０ 一般席
event_summary: 【当選者には当日１０時からEXPO アリーナ「Matsuri」にて整理券を配布いたします。ランダムな入場順で配布しますので、早い時間にお並びいただいても、整理券に書かれている番号が後半の順番となることがあります。急がずに配布場所にお集まりください。】“日本人が今一番好きなダンスを決定！大阪・関西万博会場で2,000人以上の方々とともに踊りまくる！”という夢のプロジェクトが始動します。昭和・平成・令和それぞれの時代で「日本人が一番踊りたい曲」をランキング形式で紹介し、アーティスト本人も続々登場します。日本中が一体となって踊る感動の瞬間を創り上げます！

event_name: ZUTOMAYO OMOTE EXPO 2025 “MEIKŌ WA GUNARUGA GOTOSHI”
event_summary:
Doors Open: 17:45
Event Time: Starts at 19:00 / Scheduled to end at 20:15
This is a standing-only event with designated block sections.

The audience area is divided into two sections: PREMIUM Area and Expo Reservation Area.
For more details, please check the seating image provided.

To attend this event, you must purchase an admission ticket for Expo 2025 Osaka, Kansai, and make a date and time reservation for Tuesday, September 2, the day of the event, in advance.

Please note that children under 6 years of age (preschool children) are not permitted to attend this event.

For customers requiring wheelchair-accessible seating, staff will provide assistance on the day of the event.

Inquiries: Kyodo Information 0570-200-888 (Weekdays 12:00–17:00)

event_name: The power of Intellectual Propertybuilds tomorrow Guide tour
event_summary:
The Japan Patent Office presents "The Power of Intellectual Property to Change Tomorrow" at "WASSE."
Would you like to experience the power of intellectual property more deeply through a guided tour?
In this tour, you will visit several booths with Patent Office staff, listening to explanations of real-world applications of intellectual property while seeing, touching, and experiencing the exhibits yourself.
While no reservation is required for general entry, booking the guided tour grants you priority access.【Please arrive at least 10 minutes before the start】

event_name: Signature Opening Event Stage.1
event_summary: Stage.1 Talk session with theme producers and special supportersThe Expo Thematic Project, 'Signature Project,' is a special initiative to symbolize the spirit of Expo 2025 Osaka, Kansai, Japan. Join us on the opening day as eight producers and dazzling guest performers come together for a lively celebration, exploring the profound meaning of 'Life' with joy and excitement!※ Please note that event details are subject to change without prior notice.

event_name: Signature Opening Event Stage.2
event_summary: Stage.2 Ballet dancer Emi Hariyama performs 'The Grateful Crane' as a prayer for peaceThe Expo Thematic Project, 'Signature Project,' is a special initiative to symbolize the spirit of Expo 2025 Osaka, Kansai, Japan. Join us on the opening day as eight producers and dazzling guest performers come together for a lively celebration, exploring the profound meaning of 'Life' with joy and excitement!※ Please note that event details are subject to change without prior notice.

event_name: ウィーン少年合唱団とモーツァルト コスタバイオリン 一般席
event_summary: 一般席  世界的に有名なウィーン少年合唱団が、2025年大阪・関西万博にて、オーストリアのナショナルデーを記念し、特別コンサートを開催いたします。歴史的な特別な瞬間に、モーツァルトのオリジナルコスタバイオリンの生演奏は、合唱団と初めての共演となります。 オーストリアと日本間の音楽的かけ橋となるクラシックの名作を、音楽の伝統と文化的遺産のユニークな相互作用が奏でる華やかなプログラムをお楽しみください。

event_name: ウィーン少年合唱団とモーツァルト コスタバイオリン 車椅子席

event_name: “Under the Midnight Rainbow” Presented by DAIKIN | SUNTORY Reserved Area
event_summary: Held nightly at the Water Plaza, A Spectacle of Air and Water “Under the Midnight Rainbow” uses water, air, light, fire, images, and music to depict the story of life on a grandiose scale. Show is approx. 20 minutes.*Start time varies seasonally/Children under 3 do not require reservations/Reservations are for general admission only/Seats and standing areas are on a first-come, first-served basis/Umbrellas are prohibited at this outdoor venue/Please arrive 30 minutes before the start time/Time and performance may be changed or canceled without notice. (Reservations cannot be rescheduled.)

event_name: Wheelchair Users Only – “Under the Midnight Rainbow” Presented by DAIKIN | SUNTORY Reserved Area
event_summary: Held nightly at the Water Plaza, A Spectacle of Air and Water “Under the Midnight Rainbow” uses water, air, light, fire, images, and music to grandly depict the story of life. Show is approx. 20 minutes.*Start time varies seasonally/Reservations are only for those using a wheelchair and for one additional standing companion/Seats and standing areas are on a first-come, first-served basis/Umbrellas are prohibited at this outdoor venue/Please arrive 30 minutes before the start time/Time and performance may be changed or canceled without notice. (Reservations cannot be rescheduled.)

event_name: Dynamic！ふとももシアター
event_summary: 【来場は開始10分前までに】/【車いすでの参加の際は車いす用エリアへご案内】/【3歳以下席予約不要】。【概要】ギャラリーウエストでは8/8～29の22日間、会場に訪れた世界中の人々に競輪の躍動感を発信！巨大なふともものお出迎えや大迫力のイマーシブシアター、様々な魅力あふれる体験をぜひお楽しみください！「Dynamic！ふとももシアター」は、競輪の最大の魅力「躍動感」を詰め込んだシアター。競輪場で感じられる熱気、自分自身が競輪選手になったかのような体感と興奮。覚めることのない没入感を体験しよう！

event_name: MIRAI KOBE CANVAS～Let's draw the symbols of Kobe , and the future Kobe together!～

event_name: 守口市の極～未来へつなぐものづくり～
event_summary: 【概要】守口市は、ものづくりの企業が、800近くもあり、長年大手メーカーの協力会社として活躍し、独自の技術を持っている多くの企業があります。本イベントは、守口市内のものづくり企業で、高い技術力を有する「極の守の会」の会員企業が、未来の自転車の試乗体験や、それぞれの企業の強みを活かしたものづくり体験、技術を結集した製造品の展示などを実施することで、来場された方々が、守口のものづくりの魅力や未来を存分に体感できるイベントとなっております。ぜひ会場にお越しください！【開催時間10時～16時】

event_name: [Junior SDGs Camp]Let's Learn about the Biodiversity in Noto
event_summary: 【Date: August 27th】【①13:00-14:00　②14:30-15:30　③16:00-17:00】【Target age group】Elementary school student 【Summary】In this program, the venue and Noto will be connected in real time for live interaction. Elementary school students will learn about Noto’s current situation after the earthquake and heavy rains and deepen their understanding of the importance of its natural environment and biodiversity. Local Noto pupils will also join on site and, together with the expo participants, explore what they can do to protect their region’s natural environment. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name: [Junior SDGs Camp]Learning from the Noto Peninsula Earthquake and Heavy Rains
event_summary: 【Date: August 28th】【①13:00-14:00　②14:30-15:30　③16:00-17:00】【Target age group】High school student 【Summary】In this program, the venue and Noto will be connected for live interaction. Participants will hear directly from local residents about Noto’s current situation, challenges, and reconstruction efforts, and learn from their firsthand accounts. event_name: [Junior SDGs Camp] Climate Change and our Hope: through the case of RCE South Rift, Kenya
event_summary: 【Date: August 29th】【①12:00-13:00　②14:00-15:00　③16:00-17:00】【Target age group】JHS,HS 【Summary】The session aims to empower youth and children in Japan and beyond by enhancing their understanding of global issues through the example of RCE South Rift’s environmental education in Kenya and interactive modules. Through exploring how each global citizen, regardless of nationality, contributes to climate change and learning from the three-growing activities involving Kenyan children this session will discuss individual actions that contribute to building a sustainable future for all.  *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name: [Junior SDGs Camp]Guardians of Our Own: Protecting Indigenous Lifeways and Biodiversity
event_summary: 【Date: August 30th】【①12:00-13:00　②14:00-15:00　③16:00-17:00】【Target age group】High school students 【Summary】This session will showcase a “day in the life” of Indigenous youth in Gombak, navigating both traditional and modern settings within a biodiverse environment. It also aims to promote recognition of Indigenous knowledge and lifeways which help address the global issue of biodiversity conservation.  *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name: [Junior SDGs Camp]Circular Solutions for Plastic Waste: Protect our Land, Water and Air

event_name: [Junior SDGs Camp] Let's think about SDGs through music
event_summary: [Date: August 1st 11:00–12:00, August 2nd 15:00–16:00][Target Audience: Elementary and junior high school students] [Summary]This workshop explores environmental issues and technology through music. We will perform using various instruments and estimate CO2 emissions from each performance. This helps participants think about how everyday actions impact the environment. We'll also present a song created by AI on an environmental theme. Participants will try a fill-in-the-blank lyrics quiz to reflect on how technology and environmental awareness can work together in fun and meaningful ways. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name: [Junior SDGs Camp]Harvest for Tomorrow2025 Saves the World With Better Self-Sufficiency
event_summary: [Date: August 1st 15:00-16:00, August 2nd 11:00-12:00][Target grade: For upper grades of elementary school] [Summary] It is an experiential program with the theme of food and agriculture. Through simulation games, workshops, and video classes, you can enjoy learning about food self-sufficiency and contribution to food loss.  *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name: [Junior SDGs Camp] Let's aim for zero food loss with the “Manpuku Game”!

event_name: [Junior SDGs Camp]Learn SDGs from Minabe: GIAHS & Japan's Top Ume Town
event_summary: [Date: Sep 20th][Time: 11:00-12:00, 13:00-14:00, 15:00-16:00][Target age] Junior high school students and above [Summary] EMBA Tech collaborate with local goverment to implement SDGs learning programs. Welcome to Minabe Town, Wakayama-the top producer of ume in Japan! Join our workshop to discover the secrets behind GIAHS site “Minabe-Tanabe Ume System,” Enjoy a 60 minutes with activities like a health-boosting ume quiz ! Every participant will receive a special umeboshi (pickled plum) gift. Come and experience the charm of Minabe, a certified SDGs Future City, with all five senses! *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name: [Junior SDGs Camp] Learn About Sustainable Hotels at Super Hotel!
event_summary: [Date: September 23th][Time: 13:00-14:00, 15:00-16:00][Target age] Junior high school students and above [Summary] EMBA Tech collaborate with companies to implement SDGs learning programs. Super Hotel, with over 170 locations across Japan, is the only hotel chain officially certified as an “Eco-First Company.” As a sustainable hotel contributing to the SDGs, it offers “eco-stay” options that offset CO2 emissions from lodging and serves breakfasts made with JAS-certified organic vegetables. It’s a perfect opportunity to explore ideas for sustainable tourism and an SDGs-conscious lifestyle! *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name: [Junior SDGs Camp]Let's Explore Environmental Issues through EPS
event_summary: [Date: September 25th][Time: 11:00-12:00 (OPEN10:40)][Target age] 3rd grade elementary to junior high school students (high school students also welcome) [Summary] This interactive class uses a familiar material-Expanded Polystyrene (EPS)-to explore environmental issues and the SDGs through fun experiments and quizzes. It’s a great opportunity to learn about sustainability and may even spark ideas for your next science project! *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name: [Junior SDGs Camp] Cross-Cultural Experience Workshop: Traveling the World through VR
event_summary: [Date: September 27th][Time: 11:00-12:00, 13:00-14:00, 15:00-16:00 (registration starts 20 minutes before the event)][Recommended age] For middle and high school students [Summary] Using VR, junior high and high school students can virtually visit the home countries of Otemon Gakuin University's international students and experience the nature and cityscapes of those countries, deepening their understanding of different cultures. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name: [Junior SDGs Camp] 『BARASHIN-PICK』 A festival for enjoyning sorting wastes
event_summary: [Date: September 26th][Time: 11:00-12:00 (OPEN10:40)][Recommended age] 6th to 12th years old [Summary] This is experiential program where you can learn the importance of sorting and recycling by desmatling electonic devices. By desmatling electonic devices, you will learn the importance of sorting waste  into each materials. In addition to the dismantling experience, you will experience recycling by hand making original resin accesaries by using the parts which used in devices you desmantled. (Your handmade resin accesaries will be given as gifts!) *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name: [Junior SDGs Camp] Carbon-Minus Project
event_summary: [Date: September 13th][Time: 13:00-14:00 (OPEN12:40)][Recommended age] Elementary school lower grades to high school student [Summary] Set against key themes like climate change, decarbonization, and resource circulation, this program explores the role of biochar through hands-on experience and real-life examples. Discover how biochar is used in daily life and the many jobs connected to it, while thinking together: “How can we get involved?” “What kind of future do we want to create?” Let’s learn with curiosity and take the first step toward action! *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name: [Junior SDGs Camp] What is renewable energy? Let's think about it together!
event_summary: [Date: August 4th][Time: 11:00-12:00, 13:00-14:00, 15:00-16:00][Recommended Age] Junior high school students and above [Summary] Using models of solar and wind power -two types of renewable energy- participants will engage in hands-on activities and dialogue to deepen their understanding of how social rules (such as siting restrictions and guidance) are created, using the fictional town of “Banpaku City” as a case study. Through discussions on renewable energy, participants will experience how to understand different perspectives and build consensus through dialogue.

event_name: [Junior SDGs Camp] Let's look at the environment through the lens of money!
event_summary: [Date: August 9th][Time: 11:00-12:00, 13:00-14:00, 15:00-16:00][Recommended Age] Junior high school students and above [Summary] This program explores how the “lens of money” can contribute to the SDGs—specifically in areas such as environmental conservation, economic growth, and climate change action. Participants will have the opportunity to personally reflect on how to balance environmental conservation and economic growth, as well as present and future needs. Various research cases that measure the value of the environment using economic indicators will be introduced.

event_name: [Junior SDGs Camp]Youth Presentation on Climate Change and Glocal Action
event_summary: [Date: October 4th][15:00-16:00 (OPEN14:40)][Target age group： Above middle school age][Summary] We will present initiatives by youth from Shikoku area who have taken action triggered by awareness and learning about climate change. Participants will ask the presenters questions and share their thoughts, thinking together about what actions can be taken, and collectively declaring a glocal action!

event_name: [Junior SDGs Camp]Sustainable Urban Public Transportation, “MONORAIL”
event_summary: [Date: October 2nd, 3rd][Time: 13:00, 15:00-16:00][Target Age Group: Elementary school students and above][Summary] Monorails are public transportation with no exhaust emissions, low noise, low vibration, low environmental impact, and excellent scenery that harmonizes with the cityscape. In this workshop, you can learn about the history, technology of monorails and environmental considerations.　In addition, before and after the workshop, you can freely learn the structure of monorails through panels, videos, model exhibits. You can also enjoy coloring a picture of monorails.

event_name: Osakagas　Methanation　Demonstraition　Project（General use）
event_summary:
Osaka Gas metanation tour  is a plant tour in the Area Carbon Recycle Factory of making methane with carbon dioxide (CO2) and hydrogen. We gather the CO2 collected from the atmosphere or the biogas and  use it as raw materials of the city gas, which we use as the fuel  for the kitchen of the guesthouse,  : Approx.40 minutes. You will be transported to the  plant by a dedicated bus ** departing from the front of the Gas Pavilion. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.
**The bus will depart on time, so if you are late you will not be able to participate. Thank you for your understanding and cooperation.

event_summary: 【Date: June 9th】【11:00-11:45 (OPEN10:50)】【Summary】Women’s Pavilion.▼ In this keynote, Ramla Ali will share experiences and insights from her life to show what it takes for women to rise and succeed in leadership roles, from sports and the arts to business and government. Reflecting on her own journey, she will share real ways to remove the barriers that hold women back and highlight the importance of education, mentorship, and access in creating steady paths to leadership. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name: WA Space<SUSTAINABLE LEGACY: Living in Harmony with Nature>
event_summary: 【Date: June 10th】【15:00-15:45 (OPEN14:50)】【Summary】Women’s Pavilion.▼In this session, Japanese freediver and Ocean Ambassador Ai Futaki will share how her world record-breaking dives have shaped a philosophy of coexistence with nature. event_name: WA Space<HOUSEHOLD TRANSFORMATION: Balancing Gender Roles with Societal Changes>
event_summary: 【Date: June 11th】【11:00-11:45 (OPEN10:50)】【Summary】Women’s Pavilion.▼ When it comes to gender equality, inclusive workplaces, and shared responsibility, impact of household dynamics cannot be overlooked. Despite notable advances in policy and public discourse on gender, many households still reflect deeply ingrained gender biases. This session with Dr. Mariko Bando will explore gender divides in the workplace, the role of culture, conditioning and household dynamics, and the meaning of dignity. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

In this session, impact entrepreneurs Namita Banka, Kristin Kagetsu and Mariam Torosyan will discuss the conditions for businesses with social and environmental impact to flourish and explore untapped opportunities for businesses to make a real difference.  *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name: WA Space<ENCODING EQUALITY INTO THE AI ALGORITHM>

event_name: WA Space<THE INDISPENSABLE NATURE OF RELATIONSHIPS>
event_summary: 【Date: June 16th】【16:30-17:30 (OPEN16:20)】【Summary】Women’s Pavilion.▼As loneliness grows, the need for real human connection feels more urgent than ever. Through their art, they question, rebuild, and reimagine what it means to connect. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name: WA Space<THE RETURN OF HUMANITY>
